messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] begging for Lord of the Rings cards
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/4/02 7:54:58 AM Central Standard Time, ... Yeah, what s up with that?  I m still having to raise my broken ankle above my head and am
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/4/02 7:54:58 AM Central Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:

> posted this on the big list (which is mysteriously dry lately)

Yeah, what's up with that? I'm still having to raise my broken ankle above
my head and am missing the days of having reach my 1000 email limit. All
those emails really saved my sanity in the first few weeks of my recovery.

Elizabeth

messages.subject: begging for Lord of the Rings cards
messages.msgSnippet: I posted this on the big list (which is mysteriously dry lately), but wanted to ask the best folks too (and there are a fair number here who aren t on
messages.messageBody:
I posted this on the big list (which is mysteriously dry lately), but wanted
to ask the best folks too (and there are a fair number here who aren't on
unschooling-dotcom).

If you purchased or will receive for Christmas the boxed set of the extended
version of The Fellowship of the Ring (with the bookends), IF you do not have
gaming-children, Kirby begs me to beg you to let him have the few collectible
cards that come with that.

I didn't know about the playing cards when I opted for the four-DVD set
without frills. He's greatly troubled about that, and asked me please to ask
my homeschooling friends who might have just lost the cards, given them to
young children who don't need them, or used them for bookmarks or some such.

We could trade other card-stuff, or negotiate for some compensation to those
who might be willing to part with the cards.

And he wouldn't mind having more than one set if that's a possibility.

He's getting involved in playing that game, his main interest is Faramir, and
apparently the cards in that set are unavailable otherwise.

Thanks!

Sandra
